container.heading: Lawful and Unlawful Electronic Gaming Devices

section.heading: Lawful Electronic Gaming Devices.
section.text: An electronic gaming device is lawful if it is:

para.text: An antique electronic gaming device that is not operated for gambling purposes.

An electronic gaming device that is in the possession of or being transported by a person to demonstrate or sell the electronic gaming device to a prospective customer who is allowed to purchase an electronic gaming device if the person:
Operates with or under a distributorship contract with a manufacturer of an electronic gaming device;
Is registered with the United States Department of Justice as a distributor of electronic gaming devices; and
Has provided the Secretary of State Police with a copy of the person’s current federal registration.
An instant bingo machine operated in compliance with COMAR 36.07.

section.heading: Unlawful Electronic Gaming Devices.
section.text: An electronic gaming device is unlawful if it is not authorized by Regulation .01 of this chapter.

annotations.annotation: Criminal Law Article, §§12-301—12-308, Annotated Code of Maryland
